Key Match Events: The Yankees led off the bottom of the first inning with consecutive hits by Gleyber Torres and Juan Soto to put runners on the corners.
The Yankees then led off the second with three straight hits, including an Alex Verdugo RBI double to extend their lead to 2-0.
The Guardians responded with a two-run fifth to cut their deficit to 3-2 and end Gerrit Cole's night on the mound.
Post-Match Reflections: The series now shifts to Cleveland with the Guardians in desperate need of a Game 3 victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians used eight pitchers on the night and are surely thankful for the day off on Wednesday.
Others: The Yankees get to Bibee early
The Guardians responded with a two-run fifth to cut their deficit to 3-2 and end Gerrit Cole's night on the mound.
The Yankees' bullpen did its job for the final 4 2/3 innings.
Aaron Judge finished 1-for-3 at the plate with three RBI and a run scored on his home run.
Torres was 3-for-5 with two runs scored in the leadoff spot.
